caption:
This photograph depicts an indoor scene set in a diner or café with a distinctly retro aesthetic, likely from the 1960s or 1970s. The scene includes two people: a man on the left and a woman on the right. Both are seated at what appears to be a counter, with their profiles facing towards a large pair of white underpants hung on the wall behind the counter. These underpants bear the iconic slogan "MAKE LOVE NOT WAR" in bold, blue capital letters.

The man wears a cap and is dressed in a dark zip-up jacket. He is captured in profile, looking toward the underpants. The woman has a stylish hairdo typical of the era, and wears a light blue sleeveless top. She is looking down, her hand partially covering her face in a contemplative or possibly emotional gesture. 

The background is a plain wall adorned with various decorations. On the left part of the wall, there’s a framed picture of a rural landscape and three flower arrangements in wall-mounted baskets. To the right, there is another framed picture, more flower baskets, and a calendar hanging near the underpants. The table surface is visible in the foreground, featuring a napkin dispenser, condiments, and a black handbag next to the woman, indicating she may be preparing to leave or has just settled in.

The interior lighting casts a warm glow, enhancing the intimate and somewhat solemn mood of the image. The photograph captures a quiet, poignant moment, possibly reflecting the social and cultural tensions of the time when the anti-war sentiment was prevalent.
title: Surprise for Dick Christian (at table), at Beaver Crossing High School alumni party
